column4: looking for advice, how can i test if an all-in-one printer/scanner thingee will work with ubuntu w/o plugging it in?
check manufactures site see if any linux support I know the hp 6310n works
that only shows printers not all in one's thats whats driving me crazy
isn't there an ubuntu hw database of some sort?
if it works for linux should be workable for ubuntu
k, which was the one you said worked for you?
just something I remembered it need  HPLIP 1.6.9 or later
driver package its in the repos you can apt-get install it
do apt-cache show hplip in terminal make sure its 1.6.9
im on edgy and it is
